detailsOfAchievement: AFE is an organization dedicated to creating a civil society that is conscious about the problem of, and possible solutions to, the steady degradation of earths unique ability to provide various forms of life with a liveable habitat. Set up in October 2004, as a registered charitable trust, AFE strives to achieve its mandate by designing and implementing innovative programs aimed at bridging the information divide that exists between the world of research and civil society on one hand, and policy makers on the other. AFE proactively seeks to bring together institutions from diverse fields of education, conservation, science and business on a common platform to work together and enhance human and institutional capabilities for addressing environmental and developmental concerns.

detailsOfAchievement: Thematic and Project Based Programs  Vocational training & life skills  Economic empowerment for youth and women  Self-help groups, micro credit, training and marketing for income generation  Education for marginalized children, youth and women in alternative modes  Research and Documentation  Health & Sanitation  Innovative use of Resources  Volunteer Programme  Environment AROH Foundation is a registered non-profit, non-governmental organization founded by like-minded professionals, to give back to the society. AROH team has the best minds from the academic pool, development sector and corporate management. AROH has, over past 9 years, developed sound sustainable programmes to cater to the development needs of its target community. AROH has designed and adopted a two pronged strategy to help communities to envisage their villages/slum colonies as a comfortable place to live work and socialize and chart a course for their immediate and remote future. We undertake research activities in the areas of concern to strengthen and consolidate the policy-level decisions for government schemes. Alongside, we get actively involved in action with the communities, to make a direct difference to quality of their lives. We work with a holistic, people-centric approach and besides providing livelihood opportunities, we plan and run programmes on education, health and hygiene, sanitation, etc. under the overall goal of empowerment of community. Use of indigenous talent and resources is encouraged in all projects.

detailsOfAchievement: The Art and Cultural Trust is working with the objective of promoting Indian Classical Music, Dance and Art forms by organizing concerts and conducting training programs, workshops and seminars. One of the prime aims of the trust is to especially assist women, children and youth in the field of Music and Art. We give opportunity to the learners to perform with reputed artists on the same platform, inducing confidence among them and thereby exposing them to potential role models. We are providing training and diploma through Chakrapani"s World School of Music which is working under the trust. To spread awareness among the society about our Indian Classical Dance, Music and Art forms, we are organizing "Sangeet Samman Awards Traditions", "Delhi Pratibha Puraskar" (age group 9-17 years) as well as on all Indian level (age group 18-30 years) we are organizing "Akhil Bhartiya Pratibha Puraskar" and for reputed artists we are providing awards such as "Bharat ke Sangeet Ratna", "Bharat Kala Ratna", "Sangeet Shree", "Yuva Ratna" and "Delhi Ratna"(State Level Awards). And it is a big achievement for the trust that reputed artists from all over India came to perform and receive the award like "Padma Vibhushan"- Pt. Hariprasad Chaurasia, Pt. Ram Narayan, Pt. Birju Maharaj, Dr. Yamini Krishnamurti, etc. and few name of dignitaries who came to witness the function and give the award like Ex-President of India Shree R.Venkataraman,Shri K.R.Narayanan,Lt.Governor,Honorable Supreme Court Justice Dr. Arijit Pasayat, Justice Gyan Sudha Misra and Honorable Justice Dipak Misra, and Members Parliament and Central Ministers, Govt. of India, etc.

title: ASAVARI
detailsOfAchievement: The Asavari Repertory group is credited with many path-breaking works, whether they were sensitive portrayals of social issues or whether they were explorations of rhythmic dimensions in terms of sound-scapes and emotional-scapes! The Asavary Repertory group mesmerized audiences at home and abroad. Asavari has organized a number of prestigious music and dance Festivals featuring stalwarts in the field of classical performing. It also holds an annual Festival LalitArpan that has been promoting young and talented classical artistes with stupendous success. The Festivals that have seen the Asavari group mesmerizing the audience include Kathak Mahotsavas at Delhi, Calcutta, Lucknow to name a few, Bindadin Mahotasava, Kalka Mahotsava, Khajuraho, Lucknow Mahotsava, Badrinath Festival, Magh Festival at Allahabad, Ganga Mahotsava at Benaras (Varanasi), Durga Puja Festivals and Dussehra Festivals at Patna, Pune Festival, Ganesha Festival, Tourism Festivals of Delhi Tourism, India Tourism, Tamilnadu Tourism etc, Qutab Festival, Surya festivals at Trivandrum, Konark Festival at Konark (Orissa), Modehra Sun Temple Festival (Gujarat), Brindaban Festival, Patiala Heritage Festival, Commonwealth Games Baton Unveiling, Earth Day, to name a few including tours abroad to China, Japan, USA, Middle East, South East Asia etc. Detailed training in technical skills and abhinaya in the field of Kathak has been an ongoing process. The various activities of Asavari that have included presentation of young soloists, group choreographies and ballets, have earned rave reviews. They have clearly shown the seriousness and depth in which training is being imparted to all. Asavari continues to be at the forefront in the effort to preserve and promote Indian arts and heritage throughout the world. Not only have these efforts provided the traditional Indian performing arts a modern interpretation and relevance, given them a global perspective but have also produced a large number of highly talented and committed artistes who have done the nation proud in International Festivals and countries such as the U.S.A., U.K., Germany, and East European Countries.

detailsOfAchievement: Asha with its community based holistic development activities have progressively impacted the lives of slum dwellers since its inception. Today, immeasurable improvements in physical, social and socio economic conditions of slum dwellers are evident from the fact that community members are actively promoting and supporting the programmes. In its 28 years of existence, Asha has developed a comprehensive model of service delivery where Healthcare services are combined with other Social Determinants in order to bring about comprehensive transformation. Currently Asha is working in 71 slums across Delhi covering a population of more than 5 Lakhs. The Healthcare Services provided by Asha is widely recognized by institutions across the world for efficiency, impact and quality. Asha has trained women working in slums who are engaged as Community Health Volunteers. They regularly visit and monitor the health of communities particularly pregnant women, children under five, elderly and T.B. patients. Through committed efforts by Asha, almost 100% deliveries across slums have been institutional or by the help of trained professionals. Infant mortality rates and Maternal Mortality rates have reduced significantly. Asha communities are adequately manned by doctors, nurses and paramedical staff. In addition, mobile health clinics cater to areas which do not have health centres. For advanced Healthcare and Diagnostics, Asha Polyclinic is well equipped with sophisticated laboratory, X-ray, ECG, Ultrasound and other diagnostic facilities. CHVs are provided regular trainings which are time to time supplemented by Refresher trainings. Asha has developed a Comprehensive Education Programme where final year school students are chosen and provided thorough training in Academic, Behavioural and Psychological aspects so that they excel in their chosen fields and are ready to pursue higher education. There are English Literacy and Computer courses to provide these much needed skills to students. Internship programmes for Final year students and Graduates have recorded impressive growths and students across Asha slums have been placed in MNCs as well as top Indian corporates. This has been a huge boost to their careers. Moreover, Mentorship programme undertaken by Asha has been a huge success with a professional Mentor assigned to each student who provide counselling, guidance and advice to add cutting edge to the professional career of students. Empowerment programmes have been the bedrock of Ashas Development Interventions. Bal Mandal and Mahila Mandal are the forums for discussion and solving Community issues relating to Health, Sanitation, Infrastructure, Education, Public Health and also for raising Awareness and Sensitization. These forums have also increased the Collective Bargaining power of slum dwellers. Finally, Financial Inclusion programme across slums have facilitated economic independence and empowerment and have helped many slum dwellers to earn a living and support their familys needs.

detailsOfAchievement: Ms.Rita Panicker was awarded the Lifetime Achievement Award 2016 by the National Association of Professional Social Workers in India for her distinct contribution in the domain of child rights, especially street & working children at the 4th Indian Social Work Congress.  Rita Panicker honoured by Shri Amitabh Bachan in the new Star Plus show Aaj Ki Raat Hai Zindagi 2015  Vanitha Woman of the Year 2013 by the Malayala Manorama group. Award instituted to acknowledge the work done by Malayali women to serve our society  IGSSS Shrestha Puruskar,2011, by the Indo Global Social Service Society in New Delhi for pioneering work in bringing significant changes in the lives of street and working children.  Nominated in 2009 for the "Right Livelihood Award" and was one of the finalists for the award.  Women of Social Work Excellence by Manava Seva Dharmasamvardhani Charitable Trust for Social Service Consciousness, Chennai, on 27 February 2002.  Childrens Development Khazana started by Butterflies in 2001 received the Second Prize in the 2006 Global Development Network Award for the Most Innovative Development Project. This award is given to the institution whose ongoing project embodies a fresh approach to an important development need and holds the greatest promise for benefiting the poor in developing and transition countries. Criteria include the degree of innovation and the potential for broad application of the project in other countries.  The Ramachandran Ikeda Award 1999 was conferred on Butterflies in appreciation of their work in education, healthcare and recreation of street and working children. The award was conferred on Butterflies for following Gandhian philosophy of education i.e. schools should be living school where children are taught life skills education, to respect work especially those who work with their hands and to respect and accept all irrespective of language, religion or caste.
